meanings.definition: The process of germinating and drying grain, especially barley, for use in brewing or distilling.
meanings.sent1: The malting of barley is essential for making beer.
meanings.sent2: Breweries rely on malting to produce their signature drinks.
meanings.sent3: Why did the barley start malting? It wanted to become a tasty beverage!
meanings.sent4: The transformation from grain to malt is like a caterpillar turning into a butterfly through malting.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of malting barley filled the air, promising a delicious drink soon.

meanings.definition: A facility where malting is carried out.
meanings.sent1: The local malting plant provides malt for nearby breweries.
meanings.sent2: Workers at the malting facility ensure the grains are properly processed.
meanings.sent3: The malting building was so busy that even the grains had to wait in line!
meanings.sent4: The malting facility stood tall like a castle dedicated to creating malt.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the malting plant was like stepping into a magical world of brewing ingredients.

meanings.definition: The act of converting grain into malt.
meanings.sent1: His expertise in malting led to the creation of high-quality malt products.
meanings.sent2: Malting involves precise steps to ensure the grain becomes malt.
meanings.sent3: The magician's secret trick was turning grain into malt through malting!
meanings.sent4: In the world of brewing, malting is the alchemical process of turning grain into liquid gold.
meanings.sent5: The art of malting requires patience and attention to detail to achieve perfect malt.
